'speaker_A': 'So, um, in particular I was thinking, um, in in the hybrid framework, just taking those LNA files, and, um,'
'speaker_A': 'setting to zero those probabilities that, um that these phones are not voicing.'
'speaker_A': 'So say, like, I know this particular segment is voicing,'
'speaker_A': 'um, I would say, uh, go into the corresponding LNA file and zonk out the the posteriors for, um, those phonemes that, um, are not voiced,'
'speaker_A': 'and then see what kinds of improvements I get.'
'speaker_A': 'And so this would be a useful thing, um, to know in terms of, like, which which, um which of these'
'speaker_A': 'categories are are good for, um, speech recognition.'
'speaker_A': 'I hope to get those, uh those experiments done by by the time quals come come around in July.'
'speaker_F': 'So do you just take the probabilities of the other ones and spread them out evenly among the'
'speaker_A': 'I I I was thinking OK, so just set to set to some really low number, the the non voiced, um, phones.'
'speaker_F': 'That will be really interesting to see, you know.'
'speaker_F': 'So then you're gonna feed the those into'
'speaker_F': 'Uh, wh are you gonna do digits or?'
'speaker_A': 'Yeah, m Um, well, I'm gonna f work with TIMIT'
'speaker_F': 'So where do the outputs of the net go into if you're doing phone recognition?'
'speaker_A': 'Um, the outputs of the net go into the standard, h um, ICSI hybrid, um, recognizer.'
'speaker_F': 'An and you're gonna the you're gonna do phone recognition with that?'
'speaker_A': 'And, uh, another thing would be to extend this to, uh, digits or something where I can look at whole words.'
'speaker_A': 'And I would be able to see, uh, not just, like, phoneme events, but, um, inter phoneme events.'

'speaker_A': 'You know, so something that is transitional in nature.'
